subject: A WORLD OF ICE AND FIRE Releasing TODAY!
event:
The long anticipated release of the official untold history of Westeros happens TODAY. It boasts 300 pages of back story and original artwork by the some of the world's top fantasy illustrators.  This one-of-a-kind coffee table book contains maps, folk lore, detailed family histories, and endless insider information dealing with the world of Westeros.  Providing vividly constructed accounts of epic battles tackled by famous heroes, and their journies before becoming important figures in the Song of Ice and Fire series.
Co written by the illustrious Elio Garcia and Linda Antonsson masters of Westeros.org, the World of Ice and Fire is a true insiders perspective on all things Westeros and a little bit of Essos too. Here is a quick video:
This message was brought to you by the Minions of Fevre River-

props.crosspost_tw: A WORLD OF ICE AND FIRE Releasing TODAY! http://j.mp/1tEWXye

comments.article: I'm so excited for this! :D I thought it would release on the same day over here, but alas, no bookstore has it in stock. And hence I wait another day (but that's OK! XD)
I'm expecting mine to show up on my doorstep any minute now. I know what I'm doing this evening.  This new tome, my favorite chair and a glass of Dornish Red are involved!

Great news indeed. I pre-ordered the book almost a year ago, and finally got it today. Thanks a lot!

One thing I was hoping to find in it was the official chronology of events in "A Song of Ice and Fire" books. Alas, it wasn't there. Is there any hope that one day it will be published?

Big day for you George.

I know you have been talking about this book for close to 10 years now, and working on it...who knows. I know it's not Son of Kong, and you completed your part a while ago, but seeing this book released must be relieving to have another (slightly larger) monkey off your back.

This is beautiful, I own two first editions of A Game of Thrones that I picked up in two separate charity stores years ago. From that moment, long before HBO, I was hooked! This is really a great addition.

Thanks!
comments.subject: Brilliant!

comments.article: I'm so excited, waiting for it to get here. :D
comments.subject: The World of Ice & Fire

comments.article: I received my copy this morning at work, the whole day I was so excited to open the package. Now I rush home, lounge on the sofa and start learning about my favorite world's secrets :)
comments.subject: Excited...

comments.upictitle: Soufflé Girl Wannabe: GoT Jaime Smirky by Queen of Thorns
comments.article: My copy is due here today courtesy of Amazon. Can't wait to read it. :)
I've had it pre-ordered for a long time. Very eager to see how this project turned out. No doubt it'll be well worth the wait, as with all things Ice & Fire.
comments.subject: Very excited. Love fake history!

comments.article:
got my Kindle version about 11:00 last night (I travel constantly so I buy books in both physical and digital...I like the annotations capabilities on the Kindle App)

Inexplicably Amazon appears to have canceled my pre-order for the HC (Probably during one of the release date changes) so rather than wait 2 days I will be going to Costco to get it in my greedy little hands! :)

I'm really looking forward to the Iron Islands section! :)
Great book, fantastic (and I mean fantastic) art! About 50 pages in, required reading for the completist or (in my case as an archaeologist) 'history' buffs!
comments.subject: World of Ice & Fire

comments.article:
I just made my own LiveJournal account after seeing the video. I just wanted to say that the scene in the background of Torrhen Stark kneeling on the banks of the Trident (I believe), and other preview images I have seen all look like the kind of art I would want on my wall, in a gallery even. Are posters of these pages being released as well?

I also want to give you my compliments for the A Song of Ice & Fire books, which have been brilliant thus far (I haven't gotten a hold of all of the prequel stories as I can't find them in the local bookstores). Obviously I can't wait to see The Winds of Winter, but as a complete and unrushed product.
comments.subject: Background art and compliments

comments.article:
Preordered it at Amazon.de and got it today. A shame the book I got was damaged, so I have already wrapped it up again and ordered a replacement.
It looked really great at first glance, but I obviously haven't seen much more of it. I can't wait to get the replacement.
I am flipping through it right now and this is just... gorgeous! More than worth the price. I will treasure this forever!
comments.subject: Finally!

comments.article:
Guess what just arrived in the mail from Amazon? :) :) :) :)

George!!!! I cannot believe how gorgeous this is. OMG! You weren't kidding, and honestly, you undersold how insane this really looks. I watched the video from 92y (im in NY, but couldn't make the event), and even seeing some of the artwork ahead of time did NOT prepare me for what this thing was really going to be like. Even the binding is top notch! Wonderful!
comments.subject: The New Book

comments.article: The book seems to be getting mostly low scores on Amazon. I'm hoping this turns out to be a vocal minority taking to the Internet before anyone else to piss and moan.
comments.subject: Amazon reviews

comments.article: Just the usual trolls. I doubt that most of them have even seen the book.
comments.subject: Re: Amazon reviews

comments.article: This is the first major release from George from this series since I became a fan.  I'll be getting my copy later today...can't wait!
already own it. haven't had a chance to read anything yet, but it looks bloody fantastic! beautiful illustrations :) and I'm just so happy to call it my own.

i see that there are two other people credited with writing this, is this more of fan fiction then? i thought you did not like fan fiction at all? i have read reviews that you can clearly tell the parts that you did not write with the change in writing styles. i would really like the art, but i would like the whole story to come from just the man himself.
Calling it fan fiction is , well, moronic.

comments.subject: Those reviews are a coordinated attack
Re: Those reviews are a coordinated attack
Re: Those reviews are a coordinated attack
Re: Those reviews are a coordinated attack

comments.article: Got my copy early at Target. It's awesome. The art is absolutely breathtaking.
comments.subject: It's great

comments.article:
Beautiful, fascinating addition to A Song of Ice and Fire. Absolutely loved the art work, even the pages felt like reading a five hundred year old tome. So, thank you GRRM, Elio and Linda for this wonderful gift.
Now, darn it, I have even more questions after reading. You are a great fisherman, you sink the hook in deep. I will keep waiting and reading.
comments.subject: World of Ice and Fire

comments.article: I saw a video of your interview at the 'Y', so I'm persuaded to get the book. In the interview you  praised the work a French historian-- but I missed the name. Who was that?
comments.subject: I'm getting' the book, and a question

comments.article: Maurice Druon.
comments.subject: Re: I'm getting' the book, and a question
Re: I'm getting' the book, and a question

comments.article: Just started flipping through my copy. The art is amazing!!!!! So excited to read this!
comments.subject: Awesome!

comments.article:
Well, I just got my copy today...and wow, I can't wait to delve into it! The book is a beast...pun intended...and another knock out!

Congratulations! It just might be the literary shot on the arm I need to get me out of the reading slump I currently find myself in...Once again thank you for your hard work!

PS Got the 2015 calendar as well!
comments.subject: A Monster Book

comments.article:
Unwrapped this book... the smell was just GLORIOUS!

I honestly feared the contents couldn't stand up to the gorgeous new book smell, but it it a triumph!

Thanks, GRRM. This will fill the time nicely while the next book takes shape.
comments.subject: Got Mine
